fields.value: Higher Education General Information Survey (HEGIS), 1971-1972:  Salaries, Tenure, and Fringe Benefits of Full-Time Faculty

authorName.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value: The Higher Education General Information Survey (HEGIS)  series was designed to provide comprehensive information on various  aspects of postsecondary education in the United States and its  territories (American Samoa, Guam, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands,  and the Marshall Islands) and Department of Defense schools outside  the United States. Data are available for both public and private  two-year and four-year institutions. The HEGIS Salaries component for  1971-1972 sought data from institutions of higher education. Key data  elements, presented for up to four record types for each institution  (corresponding to length of contract and sex), include academic rank, number of faculty, and salaries.

topicClassValue.value: IDRC VI. Human Dimension of International Relations

fields.value: Version Date: 1999-02-03Version Text: 1999-02-03 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) The HEGIS Record Layout file (Part 2) is an Excel  worksheet of record layouts for all components of the HEGIS survey,  including the 1971-1972 Salaries component (see the "emp" folder in  the worksheet). (2) The titles "Employees in Institutions of Higher  Education" and "Salaries and Tenure of Full-Time Instructional  Faculty" are used interchangeably to refer to the Salaries component  of HEGIS. (3) The 1971-1972 Salaries component contains data for  survey parts 2A-2D only (Salaries of Academic Deans/Full-Time  Faculty). Tenure and fringe benefit data are not included in this data  collection. (4) This collection has not been processed by ICPSR  staff. ICPSR is distributing the data and documentation for this  collection in essentially the same form in which they were received.  When appropriate, hardcopy documentation has been converted to  machine-readable form and variables have been recoded to ensure  respondents' anonymity. (5) The codebook and data collection  instrument are provided as a Portable Document Format (PDF) file. The  PDF file format was developed by Adobe Systems Incorporated and can be  accessed using PDF reader software, such as the Adobe Acrobat  Reader. Information on how to obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided through the ICPSR Website on the Internet.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

seriesName.value: Higher Education General Information Survey (HEGIS) Series

otherGeographicCoverage.value: Virgin Islands of the United States

value: All postsecondary institutions in operation during  1971-1972 in the United States and its territories (American Samoa,  Guam, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and the Marshall Islands) and Department of Defense schools outside the United States.
